name: Kepler-319
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-319 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-319 is a star with 0.795 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.9 times its radius. It is located 1666.10 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-319 is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-319 b

Kepler-319 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.05 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 4.36 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-319.

The mass of Kepler-319 b is 3.09 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-319 b is 1.63 that of Earth. At 3.09 Earth masses, Kepler-319 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-319 c

Kepler-319 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.07 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 6.94 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-319.

The mass of Kepler-319 c is 9.83 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-319 c is 2.63 that of Earth. At 9.83 Earth masses, Kepler-319 c is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-319 d

Kepler-319 d was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.19 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 31.78 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-319.

The mass of Kepler-319 d is 7.00 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-319 d is 2.29 that of Earth. At 7.00 Earth masses, Kepler-319 d is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-319, which contains 3 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
